results.title: Shop 16
results.creator_credit: Shawn Reece, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shawn Reece had no confidence and stayed at home when he wasn’t at school. That is, until his friend convinced him to come along to Shop 16, a youth centre run by the Salvation Army in Reservoir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shawn Reece, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Raptor
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Potter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Cynthia Potter tells of her life in one of Melbourne’s Housing Commission flats and her beloved son Elvis. Energetic, with a passion for insects, Elvis makes the most of life, while Potter does the best she can with what she’s got.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Potter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Nothing impossible
results.creator_credit: Aden Daud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When his country was thrown into civil war, Aden Daud’s friends would tell him to just waiting for his time to die. Instead, Daud decided to do something about it and seek out a more secure life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aden Daud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Man proposes, God disposes
results.creator_credit: Sophia Selvakumar, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sophia Selvakumar first came to Australia, she missed her family so terribly she returned to India after 70 days. Eventually, she returned to Australia and set about making this country her new home.

results.title: Just another bump in the road!!!
results.creator_credit: Michelle Carlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Carlin loved her job caring for disabled people. It has encouraged her to take a positive outlook on life no matter how much things go wrong and in turn this has helped her through some very tough times.

results.title: Bringing me home
results.creator_credit: Karen Greer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karen Greer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Music of Mozart and Haydn
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the magnificent Haydnsaal of the Schloss Esterhazy in Eisenstadt, Austria and in the historic palaces of Vienna, the Polish Chamber Orchestra conducted by Jerzy Maksymiuk perform three beautiful pieces of chamber music by two of Austria’s greatest classical composers, Mozart and Haydn. Includes images of some of Austria’s picturesque landscapes, artworks and amazing palaces and gardens creating an ambient background to the music of the Orchestra. No commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone

Includes images of some of Austria’s picturesque landscapes, artworks and amazing palaces and gardens creating an ambient background to the music of the Orchestra. No commentary.

results.title: The Academy of St Martin in the Fields at Longleat
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Martin Wyn Griffith, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the idyllic historic Longleat House in Wiltshire, England, this program of popular classics is performed by The Academy of St Martin in the Fields conducted by world-renowned Neville Marriner (also artistic director). Neville Marriner introduces the program and provides a commentary on the history of Longleat House and the music of the great composers of the 17th and 18th centuries. Beautiful images of the Longleat Estate, both interior and exterior, accompany the music to provide an atmospheric re-creation of those earlier centuries.
